trade something ↔ off.translation[0].def: to balance one situation or quality against another, in order to produce an acceptable result
Companies are under pressure to trade off price stability for short-term gains.
trade something ↔ off.translation[1].def: a balance between two opposing things, that you are willing to accept in order to achieve something
There has to be a trade-off between quality and quantity if we want to keep prices low.
a trade-off between something and something
trade something ↔ off.translation[2].def: to balance two situations against each other in order to get an acceptable result
Companies are under pressure to trade off price stability for short-term gains
trade something ↔ off.translation[3].def: a balance between two situations in order to get an acceptable result
The legal restrictions will remain as a trade-off for allowing interstate investment.
